name: interiorize
content:
Add to word list

formal to accept or absorb an idea, opinion, belief, etc. so that it becomes part of your character: The play, as Shakespeare interiorized it, was the thing. One bad review and I'm interiorizing it. Synonym
internalize formal
More examplesFewer examplesThe Mayan speakers have interiorized the abstract spatial dimensions of their language.Try to come to terms with the "Outside", by absorbing, interiorizing it.Individuals tend to interiorize contradictory layers in their patterns of behaviour, with some being active and others latent.
